response.answer_text: Yes. Leprosy (Hansen’s disease) is a diseases. It is caused by the bacteria mycobacterium leprae or mycobacterium lepromatosis. It is easily treated with antibiotics, usually in combinations. The antibiotics used are dapsone with rifampicin, and sometimes clofazimine is added. It is a contagious disease that affects the skin, mucous membranes, and nerves of the patient. The disease can cause discoloration and lumps on the skin. If left untreated, it can cause disfigurement and deformities.
